augmentedStrong.references: Matt.11.10 Mark.1.2 Luke.7.24 Luke.7.27 Luke.9.52 2Cor.12.7 Jas.2.25 Rev.2.1 Rev.2.12 Rev.2.18 Rev.2.8 Rev.3.1 Rev.3.14 Rev.3.7

vocabinfos.lsjDefs:
ἄγγελος, ὁ, ἡ,
messenger, envoy, [Refs 8th c.BC+] — proverbial, Ἀράβιος ἄ., of a loquacious person, [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__2 generally, one that announces or tells, e.g. of birds of augury, [Refs 8th c.BC+]; Μουσῶν ἄγγελος, of a poet, [Refs 6th c.BC+]; ἄ. ἄφθογγος, of a beacon, [Refs 6th c.BC+]; of the nightingale, ὄρνις.. Διὸς ἄ. [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__3 angel, [LXX+NT+1st c.AD+]
__4 in later philosophical, semi-divine being, ἡλιακοὶ ἄ.[Refs 4th c.AD+] in R.2.243 K.; ἄ. καὶ ἀρχάγγελοι[Refs 5th c.AD+]: also in mystical and magical writings, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
__II title of Artemis at Syracuse, [Refs 5th c.AD+]

vocabinfos.shortDef:
: angel
§ angel, messenger; this can refer to a human messenger, such as John the Baptist, or messengers sent by John the Baptist or Jesus, or to the supernatural class of being that serves God: the angel
vocabinfos.mediumDef:
angel, messenger; this can refer to a human messenger, such as John the Baptist, or messengers sent by John the Baptist or Jesus, or to the supernatural class of being that serves God: the angel
one sent
vocabinfos._es_Definition: ángel  mensajero, aquel que es enviado
